characters: FUR AND TUSK AS IT CHARGES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON LOCKE, sitting on the beach -- lost in his own thoughts -- SNAPPED OUT by the sound of VINCENT barking. looks over at... WALT, holding VINCENT back as the dog strains at his leas A groggy MICHAEL sits next to him.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 2.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Walt, ya gotta keep that dog quiet.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I dunno what’s the matter with him. (pulling on leash) C’mon, Vincent-- Cut it out... Michael offers an apologetic look to Shannon and Boone, a feet away.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Sorry... SHANNON tsk with annoyance. BOONE nods, understandingly. We get QUICK POPS of some of the other regulars, stirring awake to the commotion: SAYED, CLAIRE, HURLEY, JIN and SU etc. That’s when we find... JACK, already up. And staring at something. KATE appears from behind and sidles up next to him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What is it? She follows his gaze to see he’s looking at THE FUSELAGE. From inside we hear NOISES - banging around dull thuds.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Somebody’s in there.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Everybody in there's dead.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Sawyer.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Standing right behind you, jackass. Jack looks back over his shoulder to, indeed, find SAWYER Then, turning back, and with a deep breath, Jack takes ou his itty-bitty PENLIGHT. He moves off toward the opening the ruined fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Jack...?  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 3. ON SAWYER - he throws a smirking glance to Kate, as he wh out his MEGA-WATT FLASHLIGHT. Kate rolls her eyes, then follows Jack. Sawyer follows her. Much schmuck-baiting as Jack nears the opening of the wreckage, and Locke folds into the group from the other s The others in the camp hang back. REVERSE ANGLE - the four arrive at the opening and peer i The banging and noises are louder now. And we see somethi in the foreground... something NOT HUMAN moving inside. ON SAWYER - Waiting for Jack to make a move. Then, out of patience...

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: How ‘bout I shed a little light on-- Sawyer switches his lamp on and attempts to bring it up, SHARP GRUNT is heard from inside the fuselage, and Jack blocks his arm. PUSH IN to the darkness inside the cabin as we can just m out... CLOSE-UP - SOMETHING’S HEAD turning to look at them. Moonlight glinting of its feral, furious eyes as it snort CLOSE ON JACK - Staring back at it... Without turning, he says to the others in a quiet, but urgent whisper:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: END OF TEASER
dialogues.text: 44 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuous. The others barely have time to act on Jack’s suggestion when Sawyer shines the flashlight inside.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No! From inside... SHRIEKS! THREE SMALLISH SQUEALING BEASTS come barreling out of the fuselage, fanning out in different directions. Kate SCREA as they run, and the camp is thrown into chaos. Random shouts of: “Look out!,” “What’s happening?!,” “Get away!,” etc., as some flee, some cower, others bring up m shift weapons to defend themselves as the creatures charg past them - including HURLEY, who wields a diving FLIPPER

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Aww crud, now what? ON JIN, brandishing a piece of driftwood as he commands S

dialogues.speaker: JIN
dialogues.text: (in Korean) Stay down. She obeys, staying crouched behind him. In the melee, one of the fleeing CASTAWAYS run right into CHARLIE, knocking him down onto a jagged piece of wreckag

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey-- Oww! On the ground, Charlie looks at the gash across his forea then glances up and reacts as A BEASTIE closes in on him. ON CHARLIE - Terror rising. At the very last second, he’s YANKED to his feet, flinching, as a BLUR OF FUR flashes b He glances back to discover it was JACK who pulled him out of the animal’s path. They both t just in time to see the RUSTLING OF BRUSH as the beasts disappear into the jungle. ON SAYID, shouting to the others.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: It’s alright! They’re gone!  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 5. ON BOONE, who’d been shielding a wigged out Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yeah. Way to go, Ace. ON CHARLIE and JACK...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What the bloody hell was it? ON LOCKE, nearby, staring off, stoically, in the directio the departing animals.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Boars.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We have to get rid of the bodies. WIDEN to see him conferring with Kate and Sayid as he dre Charlie’s wound.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What, bury them? There’s a whole bunch in there--

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: More than twenty. Digging will be difficult without shovels or--

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not bury. We have to burn them. The other three react, taken aback by that. Jack notices

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE JACK
dialogues.text: They’re people. -- I know they’re people, Kate...

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Burning the remains... They deserve better than--  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Than what? Getting eaten by wild animals? ‘Cause that’s what’s gonna happen. Any bodies we bury won’t stay buried for long. Look, I know it seems harsh. But that fuselage, in the sun, it’s not about what they deserve... (softening) They’re gone. And we’re not. Sayid looks at the ground, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: What you say may be true. (looks back up to Jack) But it’s not right. For us to decide how these people are laid to rest, with no regard to their own wishes -- their religions-

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We don’t have time to sort out everybody's God.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Really? Last I heard, we're positively made of time.
Charlie... -- What? I’m just saying...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m not happy about it either. But the plane crashed a thousand miles off-course. They’re looking for us in the wrong place. If they're even still looking. (then) It’s been four days. Nobody's coming. The remainder of this registers on Sayid’s face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the morning, we need everybody to start collecting wood... Dried brush... We’re going in turn that fuselage into a furnace.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Crematorium, you mean.  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 6A. Jack looks at her. And nods. Starts to exit, STOPS --  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 7.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We'll wait until the sun goes down tomorrow night to set the fire. Kate nods as Jack goes. As the others start to disperse, Charlie looks at Kate...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If he’s so eager to get this done, why’re we waiting ‘til...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He’s hoping somebody’1l see it. She crosses off as Charlie takes that in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun peeks out over the empty ocean. Another day. 47 EXT. BEACH — DUNE —- MORNING 47 ON A PILE of METAL PIECES, STRIPPINGS, WIRES and AIRPHONE WITH CORDS. Nearby lies the TRANSCEIVER from the cockpit. As a HAND reaches in and picks up a wire, TILT UP to find SAYID, carefully wrapping the wire around a cylindrical p of piping attached to a curved piece of metal.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guess I’m not the only one who didn’t sleep last night. He glances up at her, then goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: There are better uses for my time than collecting firewood.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (gets his meaning) You don’t agree with Jack. Sayid doesn’t answer her, just goes about his business. KATE (CONT’D) What're you making?

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Too soon to talk about. Not sure if it’1ll even work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 8.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You're trying to pick up the signal, aren’t you? The one we heard on the transceiver. Bingo. Reluctantly, Sayid nods.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: If the French woman's transmissions have truly been playing on a loop for sixteen years, then there must be a power source on this island. A significant one.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You can find it?

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Hypothetically... yes. (beat) I’m making an antenna, of sorts. With a few of these mounted at different points on the island, I may be able to use the transceiver to triangulate the signal. Find out where it’s coming from.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What can I do to help?

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: This is only a prototype. Testing it now may be premature...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Then it’s a good thing I test well. Sayid eyes her for a moment. Smiles. A moment. Then --

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Appears you’re as anxious to get off this island as I am. Boy, don’t we know it. Off Kate... EXT. BEACH — MEANWHILE 48 ON MICHAEL, collecting wood near the edge of the jungle. Walt sits nearby, petting Vincent, who’s tied to a tree. suddenly catches sight of HIS POV - LOCKE, sitting in the sand, unlocking a SUITCAS and lifting the lid toward camera, masking what’s inside. ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: * oF a es  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 9. ON WALT, he gets up and starts to walk off. Michael sees out of the corner of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Where you going, man?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (busted) Nowhere. MICHAEL looks over at LOCKE, now rummaging through the suitcase. WALT (CONT’D) I just thought... I wanted to go see what Mr. Locke's doing.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: How ‘bout you help your dad with the wood, okay? (beat) I’m sure Mr. Locke doesn’t want a kid hanging around him all day, anyway. Walt is obviously not keen on that option, but he grudgin begins to pick up sticks --

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: At least he talks to me. That STINGS -- but it’s kinda true, too.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Okay. lLet’s talk then. What you wanna talk about?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Forget it. As Walt sulks, Michael casts another wary eye at Locke, before picking up a final piece of wood and crossing back the fuselage, where we find... JACK, a bandana around his neck, supervising as various others bring over wood and brush. He takes Michael’s delivery and passes it along to a chain of two other MEN inside the cabin, also wearing something across their fac He casts a wary eye over at  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 10. HIS POV - A SMALL GATHERING of four or five CASTAWAYS talking, occasionally peering over. Among them is Claire, who looks at Jack, then peels away and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Doctor...?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Jack. Claire, right? (re: her belly) How’s the...?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Good. He’s good. (beat) I think maybe you should see this. She hands Jack some folded, partially SINGED papers. As h unfolds them... CLAIRE (CONT’D) Somebody found it. (pointing to the fuselage) In there. They’re collecting belongings. JACK'S POV - The pages contain hand written notes accompa by COLOR PHOTOS OF A HAPPY, YOUNG COUPLE, lovely bridal g a luxurious beach resort, floral arrangements, etc. CLAIRE (CONT’D) They're weeding plans. (pointing, reading) “Steve and Kristen’s.” They were on the plane. Sitting a couple of rows behind me. I remember ‘cause... (a little overcome) They looked... so happy. Jack quickly returns the pages to her, awkward under the weight of her raw emotion --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I-- I don’t understand, Claire, what am I supposed to do with--

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I thought... Well, some of us were wondering if maybe we should do some kind of... thing. Like a memorial service or something. You could lead it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 50 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 11.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Uh, no, I don’t think...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It’s just a few words. Or maybe we could just read off names. From the passports or driver’s licenses-- Jack’s had ENOUGH --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look -- It’s not my thing. Claire instantly backs off. Clear to her (and us) she’s pushing a button that best ain’t pushed --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Then... maybe I could do it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sounds fine. Whatever everybody wants. And with that, Jack walks off. As Claire watches him go.. EXT. BEACH - EDGE OF THE JUNGLE —- MEANWHILE 49 ON BOONE, collecting wood... He looks up as JIN, crosses by, his arms also laden with wood. They noti each other. After a moment, Boone offers:

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Hi. Jin returns the greeting with a friendly nod and moves of Boone crosses to a piece of driftwood high on the beach, suddenly sees ROSE, sitting far down the beach, near the surf, by herse REVERSE - CLOSE ON ROSE, just sitting, staring out at the sea, gently caressing the gold band she wears on a string around her neck. We can make out BOONE in the deep background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SHANNON, doing a crossword puzzle in the back of an airline magazine, as others continue to toil around her. see BOONE dump off his wood by the fuselage and cross to  "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 12.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: That woman's still sitting out there.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (barely listening) Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Her husband was on the plane. In the back.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Are you even listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What’s a four-letter word for “I don’t care?”

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: She hasn’t moved from that spot since yesterday, Shannon. (beat) Somebody should go talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I nominate you. (weary sigh) Taking care of the whole freakin’ world, one person at a time.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE SHANNON
dialogues.text: Not the whole world. Just my sister-- -- Who was doing just fine until you came along.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Yeah! You had it all together. That’s why I had to fly seven thousand miles to rescue your ass. (then) Face it, Shannon. You'd be lost without me.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Correction. I am lost with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOST "Walkabout" (PINK) 7/22/04 13.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, at least you know you won’t starve with me to take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON BOONE
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna starve... -- Yeah? What’re you gonna eat?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Ocean’s full of fish.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Hate to break it to you, but the ocean’s not gonna take your gold card. And now Shannon finally puts down her magazine. It’s ON -

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You don’t think I can catch a fish? Boone’s look at her says it all. Nope. Before she can respond, their attention’s drawn to... ANGLE ON SAWYER and HURLEY, yelling on top of one another Hurley keeps reaching for the backpack in Sawyer’s hands. Sawyer shoves him away. As they quarrel, ten or fifteen castaways converge on them.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY SAWYER
dialogues.text: -- hand ‘em over -- There's -- How ‘bout ‘no’ other people here, or don’t Well, maybe if one of us you give a crap -- didn’t eat more than his fair That’s bull and you know it -- share, wouldn’t be a short Dude, what’s your Problem?! -- Hey, I’m peachy, pork-pie. Not happy unless you’re You’re the one-- screwing over-- Boone enters the fray, trying to calm the situation.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, knock it off. C’mon --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Stay outta this, Metro--

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's going on?  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 14. Sawyer, Hurley and Boone look over to see JACK, KATE and SAYID pushing past some of the onlookers.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: (indicating Sawyer) Jethro here’s hoarding the last bags of peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: It’s my own stash. (nodding to fuselage) Found ‘em in there.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Hurley) What about the rest of the food?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: (to Hurley) There is no rest of the food, dude. It’s gone. We kinda... ate it all. The castaways start to murmur: “No food?” And PANIC begin to seep in. People are really starting to get scared. The KNOWERS doing their best to maintain order --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SAYID
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody calm down... -- We can find food. There are plenty of things on this island to sustain us. ON SAWYER, who casually leans against a row of detached airplane seats.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And exactly how are we gonna get this... sustenance? THWACK! A good-sized knife suddenly imbeds itself in the empty seat next to Sawyer. He flinches back, startled. ON JACK, KATE and the others as they turn toward the direction from which the knife had come to see LOCKE.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: We hunt. Stop. Let it sink in. The pure AUTHORITY of this man. After a moment, Kate steps toward him...  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 14A.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How'd you get that knife on the plane?  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 15. Locke eyes her a moment... then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I checked it. Jack PULLS the knife out of the seat. For a second we thi he might keep it... but instead, he offers it to Locke, h out. Sizing up this guy for the first time --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Either you’ve got good aim... (looks to Sawyer) Or bad aim, Mr...?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Locke. His name’s Locke.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay. So what is it we’re hunting, Mr. Locke? SLOW PUSH IN ON LOCKE as he speaks...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: We know there are wild boar on the island. Razorbacks by the look of them. The ones who came into camp last night were piglets... A hundred, hundred and fifty pounds each. That means there’s a mother nearby. A two-hundred and fifty pound rat with scimitar-like tusks and a surly disposition, who’d love nothing more than to eviscerate anything that comes near her... ON JACK, eyeing Locke as he continues...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... Boars’ usual mode of attack are to circle around their prey, charge from behind. So I figure it’1ll take at least three of us to flank one of the piglets, distract it just long enough for me to pin it... and slit its throat. Everyone stares at him, stunned for a moment. turns to Jack --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: And you gave him his knife back. Then Sawyer  51 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 16.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If you’ve got a better idea...

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Better than three of y’all wandering into the magic forest to bag us a hunk ‘o ham armed with one 1’il bitty knife? Hell no! That's the best idea I ever heard! With the barest of smirks, Locke takes a step toward his black bag lying nearby and deftly KICKS open the lid. REVEAL, strapped to the lid, HALF A DOZEN LARGE HUNTING KNIVES, of various shapes and sizes, along with other hun accountrements: fishing line; snake-bite kit; etc. The others REACT. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP ON LOCKE, in crisp white shirt and tie, jotting something down in an open file. Suddenly his phone TRILLS Locke picks it up:

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: » (into phone) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: CLIPPED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Col. Locke, is this line secure? Locke’s eyes dart off for a moment, before he pushes a bu on his phone console.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Line secure, GL-12. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CLIPPED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Target area is acquired. Maneuvers are a go for thirteen hundred hours. Repeat -- we are a go.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Roger that. We’1ll convene at the usual rendezvous point at -- * oF a ee ae  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 17.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Locke! Locke looks up from his call and we reveal... RANDY, an office supervisor, standing at the entrance to Locke’s cubicle. That’s right, Locke’s a mid-level management cubicle jock

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you. I need those TPS reports finished by noon today. Not twelve-thirty. Not twelve- fifteen. Noon! Locke, evenly, though clearly peeved:

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I heard you the first time, Randy. As Randy starts to leave, he adds:

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: And no personal calls during office hours. Colonel. Randy moves off, barely suppressing a snicker and we're.. CLOSE ON LOCKE, his eyes narrow, watching him go...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT ONE
dialogues.text: 52 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A KNIFE, glinting in the sunlight. Widen to see Kate holding it, looking it over, before she slides it in her belt and continues gearing up she hears:

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So you’re hunting boars now, huh? She turns and sees Jack. Hint of a smile. This will alway be their dynamic -- concern baked under the fluffy crust CHEMISTRY neither can deny. As they WALK AND TALK --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Who says this is my first time boar- hunting.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Tell me something -- How come anytime there’s a hike into the Heart of Darkness, you sign up? You know what’s in there.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Actually, I don’t. And we can see that Kate is kinda scared... VULNERABLE, e

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But at least I’ve got some experience, right? Jack smiles. She can handle herself. So he turns his attention across the beach towards -- LOCKE, filling his VEST with stuff from his suitcase...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What's your feel on our new friend?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Seems to know what he’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Call me paranoid, but anyone who packs a suitcase full of knives...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) If I didn’t know better, I’d say you were worried about me, Jack. ee eH OF * oF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOST "Walkabout" (YELLOW) 8/2/04 19.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If I didn’t know better, I’d say you've got a problem staying in one place very long, Kate. (beat) So you wanna tell me why you’re really going? Kate stops. She’s busted. Eager to break this awkward moment, Kate makes sure they’re far enough away from the others -- Opens up her pack, revealing SAYID’S ANTENNA.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sayid gave me this so he can triangulate the distress signal we heard -- Find the source.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (realizing) This isn’t about boars. She smiles as she refastens her bag and hoists it, does h best to cover her nervousness with bravado --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What can I say? I’m a vegetarian. She moves off. Jack watching her go. 53 EXT. ANOTHER PART OF THE BEACH —- MEANWHILE 53 WALT’s pleading with Michael who shoves things into a pac

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: But why can’t I come?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Because I said so -- At that moment, Michael notices SUN crossing by, holding plants she’s apparently dug up. He attempts to communicat with her pantomimicaly as he introduces himself --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, hi. I’m, uh, Michael. Mi- chael. My name.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: (gesturing to herself) Sun.  LOST "Walkabout" (YELLOW) 8/2/04

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: “Sun.” Sun... That’s-- that’s nice. Uh, listen, Sun... I’m... I... am going off... off... away... to hunt... And I was wondering... if you you could keep an eye on my boy... Walt... Y’know... Watch him for me... Until I get back...

dialogues.speaker: 19A.
dialogues.text: Sun looks somewhat apprehensive at first, then, after a moment’s thought, she nods and speaks in Korean:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 20.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: I will gladly look after your son.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Sorry... I don’t understand Japanese, but -- You’re cool with this, right?

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: (smiling shyly) Yes. And I'm Korean.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: C’mon, man. Vincent needs you here, okay? As Walt sulks, Michael adds:

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And cheer up. This’1ll give me a chance to get to know your friend Mr. Locke a little better. With that, he heads off to join Kate and Locke, as they m off into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: Try not to worry about your father. He will be all right.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. EXT. BEACH —- MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY AREA —- MEANWHILE 54 ON CHARLIE as he sits down in a quiet secluded spot, look around to see the coast is clear, then takes out his bag dope. Clearly about to take a hit, then... REVERSE ANGLE - BEHIND HIM as a pair of shapely legs come into frame. Feeling someone’s presence, Charlie turns his head and peers up at SHANNON, the sun backlighting her, haloing her head.

dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Uh, hello. Shannon, right?  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 21.

dialogues.text: Oh, um... (shoving the bag into his pocket ) N-no, not really. At the, uh... He gets to his feet. CHARLIE (CONT’D) What are you doing now?

dialogues.text: (grinning) I was wondering when you were gonna get ‘round to it. Yes. I’m the bass player from Drive Sha--

dialogues.text: Fishing? Oh, yeah... My granddad used to take me, taught me everything he knows... knew -- He’s dead god rest his soul -- Anyway, I’m, like, a... fishing fiend. (beat; confidently) England’s an island after all, in’it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HK  55 56 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 22. OFF SHANNON’s pleased look...

dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A WHEELCHAIR laden with wood, being pulled by a CASTAWAY and delivered to -- JACK, a bandana across his mouth and nose, feeding wood a dried brush into the fuselage. As the Castaway moves off, leaving the wheelchair, Boone approaches.

He reaches down, brings up some loose soil. Kate and Michael in the background. Kate steps toward Loc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e OF  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 23. He gives her a cursory glance, then tosses the dirt, stan

dialogues.text: Ground here’s been rooted up. That’s how boars get the majority of their food. Digging. Afterwards, they generally wallow in the dirt, rub up against trees -- (pointing out tree scars) --Scoring them with their tusks.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE

dialogues.text: ON ROSE, still sitting stoically, staring out as an airli blanket is suddenly draped over her shoulders. She doesn’ respond or look up as Jack sits down next to her. He hold out a half empty bottle of water:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hi. Rose, right? Remember me? Seat 23A? Getting no response from her, he adds, wryly:

dialogues.text: ON KATE and MICHAEL - MOVING -- She glances at him, then.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 25.

dialogues.text: Your son -- How’s he handling all this?

dialogues.speaker: KATE

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can't take credit for that -- I wasn’t part of his life, ‘til his mother passed away. Two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry -- I didn’t--

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: That’s okay. They were living in Sydney the past couple of years. I flew out last week. To, y’know... get him. (beat, he looks at her) What were you doing in Australia? ON KATE. Uh oh. Thankfully --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shhhhh... They halt and look to find themselves in a FIELD OF TALL GRASS. Kate and Michael FREEZE as Locke signals -- “It’s right there.” And sure enough, we see -- FLASHES of dark fur as what must be a BOAR moves through tall grass. GRUNTS. SNORTS. And shit -- it’s CLOSE. LOCKE turns toward Michael and Kate and tries to signal t silently, to flank the boar... KATE starts to move up, close to Locke, but MICHAEL, eage challenge Locke's authority, is resistant to comply.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (whispering) Quit giving us the steal sign. Damn pig doesn’t even know we’re-- A LOUD SNORT as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 26. SOMETHING EXPLODES FROM THE TALL GRASS. IT’S BIG. FLASH O

dialogues.speaker: FUR AND TUSK AS IT CHARGES
dialogues.text: Locke grabs onto Kate, pulling her out of the way of the charging BOAR. The animal sideswipes LOCKE hard, sending spinning to the ground... And continues to charge at

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: as he goes down -- Kate picks herself up a few feet away -- the GRUNTING AND SNORTING still all around them -- and makes her way to he Michael. CLOSE ON LOCKE, down on the ground, dazed -- we’re in his head space again (dream-like, SLO-MO), much like we saw h in the teaser. He props himself up and sees HIS POV - Kate reaches Michael, obviously HURT. As we continue to hear the angry SNARLS of the boar. BACK TO LOCKE as he turns his attention to... HIS FEET. Just like in the teaser. He hasn’t lost a shoe, but he doesn’t appear to be wiggling his toes, either. CLOSE ON LOCKE, continuing to stare at his legs, the soun around him fading, as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: WARREN, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON WARREN, forty-ish, short-sleeve shirt and tie.

dialogues.speaker: WARREN
dialogues.text: You've got to move, Colonel... Your troops are across enemy lines. And time’s running out. REVERSE ON LOCKE, sitting across from him, unperturbed.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Patience -- a quality you lack, GL- 12 -- is the hallmark of a leader.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 27.

dialogues.text: Really...? CUT OUT to reveal they’re seated at a table in a small of BREAKROOM -- VENDING MACHINES line one wall. On the table a GAME BOARD - A flat map of the world, with color- differentiated army figures grouped in different areas. Locke’s boss RANDY stands over them, holding a clipboard

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hallmark, huh? Tell me more about being a leader, Locke. Locke looks at him with muted annoyance, then takes a lar bite from his sandwich as Randy pulls up a chair and sits

dialogues.text: Uh, hey, John... Ya wanna move? I gotta get back to the mailroom--

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Shut up, Goldberg. (back on Locke) So where’d you serve, Colonel? Locke doesn’t like this guy, but has to take it --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I’m just playing a game, Randy. This is my lunch hour and I can...

dialogues.text: What’s a “Walkabout?” Locke STIFFENS as Randy produces a COLOR BROCHURE from hi clipboard and reads:

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Experience the dream journeys of the Aborigines as you tour the fabled Australian outback... Locke reaches over, SNATCHES the brochure from Randy’s ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 28.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE RANDY
dialogues.text: You’ve no right taking that off my-- -- So you wander around, hunting and gathering food, right? On foot?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Not that you’d understand... but a Walkabout is a journey of spiritual renewal... where one derives strength from the land... Becomes inseparable from it. (then) I have vacation days, Randy. I’m going. Already made a reservation. Warren is SURPRISED by this --

dialogues.speaker: WARREN
dialogues.text: Wow, John, you’re really doing it, huh? You tell Helen yet? Locke shoots a glance at Warren as --

dialogues.text: Helen? What’s this? Locke, you actually got a woman in your life?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: That’s none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What is it with you, Locke? Why do you torture yourself, imagining you're some globe-trotting spy or hunter... Collecting your brochures for wilderness trips, rafting down the Amazon... and Walkabouts? Wake up -- You can’t di ‘y hat!

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE RANDY
dialogues.text: (softly; to himself) Norman Croucher. -- Norman who?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Norman Croucher. He’s a double amputee. No legs. And he climbed to the top of Mount Everest. Why? It was his destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OF ee OF eK  60 LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 29. Randy knocks over a few of the army pieces, KNOWING he’s ruining the game and Locke is powerless to stop him...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That what you think, old man? You have a destiny?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Everyone has a destiny, Randy. Mine just hasn’t been revealed to me yet. While yours is to grow soft and fat, working in this office, pushing your papers and reports... Always clamoring for promotions that’1l never come. This stings. Randy leans into him, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Watch yourself, Locke. Unless you wanna find yourself out of a job. And with that, Randy pushes away from the table. As he hu out, he shakes his head, SCOFFS --

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Destiny. CLOSE ON LOCKE, relenting, his eyes drift down. Subordina by this fucking WANKER. Softly. Almost PITIFULLY --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Just... Don’t tell me what I can’t do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LOCKE, still frozen on the ground. Just looking at his legs. Lost in his own head while -- FIFTEEN FEET AWAY, Kate is with Michael. As she bends dow to look at his injury...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: How bad is it? CLOSE ON MICHAEL'S LEG WOUND - a deep GASH across his thi Kate sucks in a breath, as freaked as we are.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh -- it’s... bad.  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 29A. Kate stands, looking around through the grass -- Finally spots LOCKE on the ground. Moves towards him, concerned -  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John...? (moving to him) You all right?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: (waving her off) Fine. I’m fine, Helen. He starts to move his legs and slowly rises to his feet. LOCKE (CONT’D) KATE Just-- Just got the wind -- Helen...? knocked out of me -- What? -- You called me Helen. Locke glances at her, distracted.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I? (changing subject) Which way did the boar go?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Michael’s hurt. We've got to get him back to...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. You take him back to camp. I’11l get the boar.

dialogues.text: What -- What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I’m fine. I can do it. 30. Before she can make a move to stop him, he takes off into brush. Kate follows a few steps, calling after him...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: John -- You can’t! LOCKE!!! She stops. He’s gone. She shares a look with Michael. ON LOCKE, moving through the jungle, a man possessed...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Don’t tell me what I can’t do...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT TWO
dialogues.text: 61 LOST "Walkabout" (PINK) 7/22/04 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE REEF BED - we see a fish, swimming among the coral. It’s lovely, tranquil, then -- A POINTED STICK clumsily stabs into the water, once, twic WIDEN to find Hurley and Charlie standing on the reef, th pants rolled up to their knees. It’s Hurley stabbing the water with the spear as Charlie watches.

dialogues.text: Ya get it?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Dude -- Quit asking me that. No!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. (then) You said you knew how to catch fish.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. -- Off the Santa Monica Pier with my old man and a fishing pole and bait. Never had to poke one with a sharp stick before.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Well, anyway... Really appreciate your help.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, anything that keeps me far away from that fuselage... (stabs at the water again) And that freakin’ redneck jerk. And again, he stabs at the water. Then, frustrated, he starts beating the water with the stick.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, dammit -- crap -- Son of a --

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Er -- Maybe I can give it a go. Hurley stops pounding, hands him the stick.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Knock yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 32. Charlie readies himself, scans the water, his spear poise

dialogues.text: (spotting a fish) Okay, here comes one. Remember to put your weight into it... He’s heading your way... Easy... Wait for it... Wait... NOW! Charlie stabs hard, slips on the slick reef and falls headfirst into the water. He flails a moment before awkwardly righting himself in the shallow inlet.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aw, dude -- You were supposed You told me to put my weigh to try to pin it against-- into it-- Suddenly, in the midst of their bickering, they pause, feeling a presence, and look back at the beach to see JIN -- just standing and staring at them. Charlie, still standing in the water, and Hurley share an embarrassed look. After this awkward beat -- Jin crosses out onto the reef, squats and stares down int the water. HURLEY (CONT’D) Uh, hey, careful, man. You’re gonna scare away all the -- SPLASH! Jin’s hand juts into the water and he comes up wi a good sized fish. He turns, hands it to Charlie, nods an crosses away. OVER HURLEY and CHARLIE as they look at each other, then and watch Jin leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HANDS, bending and breaking off metal trimming f wreckage. WIDEN to see it’s SAYID. MOVE WITH HIM as he gathers his metal pieces and crosses by the Fuselage, people still filling it with brush, then... CLAIRE, sorting through a growing pile of wallets, passports, fanny-packs, etc. She notices him.

dialogues.text: Um... Is your name Sayid?  62 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 33.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: This has your name on it. ON SAYID, almost disbelieving, as he takes it from her...

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: I... I thought I’d lost this. Claire smiles and goes back to her sorting. CLOSE ON SAYID as he pulls out a batch of photographs. HIS POV - They’re almost exclusively photos of a WOMAN -- some are taken of her from behind, in others her face is

dialogues.speaker: OBSCURED BY A VEIL.
dialogues.text: SAYID, clearly elated to have these back. He continues on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JACK and ROSE, still sitting. Rose looking intently at the ring in her hand. After a beat, he looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You a religious woman, Rose? (no answer) I didn’t get much religion growing up. Just wasn’t an issue in my family. (beat) Kinda wishing it had been, y'know. After you’ve been in a plane crash... Helps to believe in... Something. After a long beat... *

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: His fingers swell. Jack sits up. Surprised she’s finally said something... *

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry? *

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Bernard. My husband. His hands swell up when we fly...  LOST "Walkabout" (GREEN ) 8/2/04

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (nodding) The altitude --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: He started having me hold onto his wedding ring whenever we took a plane trip. Always wore it around my neck for safe keeping. Just until we landed, you see... Jack nods, sympathetically. Rose finally looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Y’know, Doctor, you don’t need to keep your promise.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: The one you made to me on the plane. To keep me company until my husband got back from the restroom. (she smiles) I’m letting you off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry. You’re not getting rid of me that easily. Rose goes back to staring at the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rose... You shouldn't be out here alone. You’re suffering from a post-traumatic shock...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Aren't we all? Jack sees the humor in that and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess we are. The two share the chuckle as she looks at him again --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You've got a nice way about you. A good soul. Patient. Caring... I suppose that’s why you became a doctor. 34.  63 LOST "Walkabout" (GOLDENROD ) 8/4/04 35.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (smile fading) Thanks, but I was just kind of born into it... (pensively) Family business. Before she can say anything further, he jumps in with:

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have a family, Rose? Kids, I mean... You and Bernard?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Mm-hm. Three. All boys.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Three. That’s great. And I’m sure it’s important for you to get back to them. They need their mom.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I appreciate the thought, Doctor. But my boys are all grown. Kids get to a certain age, you need them more than they need you. Something about that seems to hit home with Jack. Almost himself:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don’t know about that.

LOCKE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT - FLASHBACK 65 We HEAR Locke’s voice speaking to someone as we PAN ACROSS a moderately low-rent apartment, littered with books; travel magazines and, inexplicably, some kind of Electronic Muscle Stimulator (EMS) Unit with several wire emanating from it. Like we talked about, Helen... We hear the filtered voice of a woman on the line.

dialogues.text: I’m not allowed to meet customers. Customer? This isn’ it isn’t

dialogues.text: (starting to fume) I_have a therapist. John--

dialogues.text: 8/2/04 38. 66  67 LOST "Walkabout" (GREEN ) 8/2/04 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON KATE and MICHAEL as they reach a small clearing. Kate suddenly stops, looking up at a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: That the guy with the gimpy leg should be deciding when we rest. She drops her bag and takes off her over-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Trying to boost the transceiver signal. I’m gonna climb this tree and attach an antenna. Michael looks up at... HIS POV - A very tall tree.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You’re gonna climb that?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Climbed a lot worse. She throws the bag over her shoulder, gets a grip on the and starts up. We follow her all the way up, using whatev outcroppings from the trunk that she can for her footing. As she reaches the top, she takes the antenna out of the and attempts to attach it with a bungee cord when she hea THAT UNGODLY SOUND and ghostly moan. ON MICHAEL, hearing it, too.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Aw, hell. BACK TO KATE as she sees: TREES, bending violently -- Something very large making its way across frame.  68 LOST "Walkabout" (GREEN ) 8/2/04 40. PUSH IN ON KATE as she realizes - IT’S BACK. The HUGE, RAVENOUS THING... She suddenly loses her grip on the antenna... GROUND LEVEL - As the antenna hits, it smashes to pieces, right before Michael.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey!! ON KATE, reaching the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s on the move.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What -- Toward us?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No. It’s going that way. Toward... She hesitates, realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What's wrong? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think it’s heading for Locke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING CLOSE ON LOCKE, as he catches sight of THE BOAR - or rather a MASS OF BROWN FUR quickly disappea into a patch of dense brush. LOCKE moves in, slowly, producing and bringing up the lar hunting knife in his hand. Then he suddenly halts as he hears, from the brush: THE BOAR SHRIEKING IN AGONY, its cries suddenly swallowed by the INHUMAN GRINDING NOISE of our jungle monster. ON LOCKE - as it gets quiet again. His mind reels with options before he becomes aware of something moving towar him. He braces himself and slowly looks up as  LOST "Walkabout" (GREEN) 8/2/04 40A. THING POV - High up, coming through the trees, finding Lo staring up at it. We hear that undefinable NOISE... ON LOCKE, as a large shadow falls over him. He stands his ground, frozen with... Awe? As he looks into the face of behemoth...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT THREE
dialogues.text: 69 LOST "Walkabout" (YELLOW) 8/2/04 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CLAIRE - sitting on a blanket, organizing the various licenses, passports, pictures, and other documents when Five other wallets are suddenly tossed onto the pile. She looks up at --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: These were, uh... Found these the other day. When I was... (screw the explanation) Ah, hell. Just take ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: (moving off) Yeah. He crosses past SUN as she extracts a vicious fluid from the roots of a p into a plastic bowl. Walt sits nearby with Vincent, watching her. Curious, despite himself.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: What... What is that? (pointing at the fluid) That! Sun smiles at him, then rubs some of the fluid across her bared teeth. WALT (CONT’D) Ohh. I get it. Like toothpaste, right? Sun nods. Then, teaching him the word in Korean, she soun it out slowly.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: Toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (repeating, in Korean) Toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: et OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOST "Walkabout" (YELLOW) 8/2/04 41a.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: Smart boy. As she gives Walt a wink, they suddenly hear somebody sho “They're back!,” and see some of the CASTAWAYS rushing to KATE and MICHAEL emerging from the jungle; Michael leanin her. ANGLE ON WALT, seeing his father.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Dad! He runs to him. She watches him go. ON KATE, handing Michael over to Hurley.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Watch his leg.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: (unsure about asking) So, like, what happened out there? Before she can answer, Walt arrives to greet Michael --

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Dad! (eyeing the blood) Your leg’s all messed up. Does it hurt?  70 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 42. ON MICHAEL - Pleased with his son’s attention and concern looks past Walt and shares a look with SUN who watches, smiling gently. He thanks her with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: S’okay, man. Not as bad as it looks. Kate turns to cross away, only to find Sawyer’s there to greet her, with his usual smirk.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: The mighty huntress returns. -- What's for dinner, honey?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not now. She crosses off. He watches her go, a little chagrined. ON MICHAEL and WALT.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Wow... So, like a boar fight --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Wasn't so much a fight. Pretty much just me getting gored. Walt suddenly thinks of something and looks around:

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Um... Where’s Mr. Locke? Off Michael, unsure how to break the news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JACK and ROSE still sitting there in the sand, staring out... THEIR POV - The sun dipping down past the horizon. ON JACK, speaking without looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Rose... After the sun goes down... We’re burning the fuselage... She looks at him and turns to her.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s... It’s just something we have to do. There’s gonna be a memorial service back at the camp. For those who... who didn’t make it. A way for everyone to say good-bye. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I’d like to be there for that. Jack's eyes widen. She’s READY.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay. He gets up and helps Rose to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe... if you’d like to say something... Y’know, about your husband... To say goodbye to him, I’m sure--

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (squinting at him) What?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m just saying... If you want to say goodbye to Bernard-- She smiles almost pityingly at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Doctor -- My husband’s not dead. 7/15/04 43. TRACK BACK with her as she turns and starts walking towar camp, leaving a stunned Jack behind. Then he follows her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He was in the tail section, Rose. It broke off in mid-flight. I’m sorry, but... Everyone in the rear of the plane’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: They're probably thinking the same thing about us. ON JACK, chewing on that, when he suddenly glances at something and freezes...  71 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 44. HIS POV - an OLDER MAN standing on the edge of the jungle near a cluster of trees, a good distance away. To us, he could easily appear to be one of the CASTAWAYS. To Jack, there’s something else. He can’t make out the man’s face, but he wears an impeccably clean, dark blue suit... And W TENNIS SHOES. JACK reacts, startled, but before he can say or do anythi he’s distracted by:

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Doctor...? Jack looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you coming? ...Then back to the Older Man. WHO’S NOW GONE. Did he cro behind the trees? OFF JACK, unnerved... EXT. BEACH — MEANWHILE 71 BOONE emerges from a gathering of some agitated people, verging on panic. He approaches Shannon...

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Looks like the hunt didn’t go well. That bald guy never came back--

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON BOONE
dialogues.text: Wait -- So they didn’t bring back any food at all? -- Did you hear what I said?! Somebody may have died out there--

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: We’re all gonna be dead if somebody doesn’t--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here we are, luv... She turns to see Charlie, holding the fish Jin caught for him. CHARLIE (CONT’D) As promised, you and me’1l be dining on fresh catch of the day. Hope you don’t mind alfresco. Oe  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 45. She grabs Boone, as

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (pleased) My fish! it from him. Then, disgusted, hands it off to Charlie waxes on...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nothin’ to it, was there? Like I said... I’m a fishing fiend. This one gave me a hell of a tussle. But I stuck with it... Y‘know, tired him out--

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: (glaring at Shannon) I don’t believe you --

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Awww, what’s the matter? Can’t stand me fending for myself?

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: (to Charlie) Listen, hey, I’m sorry about this--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Uh, no worries, mate. We were-- I mean, I was just--

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON BOONE
dialogues.text: (to Boone) What are you apologizing to -- For you -- Using this poor him for? guy, just like you use -- Oh, whatever. everybody else --

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: And, somehow, in your twisted little brain, you think this proves to me you can take care of yourself. Shannon tosses a look at Charlie then back to Boone.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (with a smirk) Told you I could catch a fish, didn’t I? Pow! ON CHARLIE, humiliated, realizing he’s been played, we hear them continue to argue. ed  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 46.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s low, Shannon. Even for you.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, go find a baby bird you can rescue or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the shattered remnants of the antenna as Kate pa them into Sayid’s cupped hands.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. (a bad joke and she knows it) I should’ve gotten the warrantee.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: I suppose I‘'1ll just try again. (frustration building) Of course, I have no welding iron, no rivets, scorched wiring... and of course, I must continue to lie to anyone who asks me what I’m actually doing...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sayid -- He looks at her and softens.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Sorry. (forces a smile) I’m cranky when I’m hungry.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (smiles back; then) We'll try it again.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: We'll try it again. They share a look, not unwarm. And smile. Then, with some seriousness...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Really think it’1l work?

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: (determined) I will make it work. ee ee Pe ee ee  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 47.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kate -- She turns as Jack approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Sayid nods to Jack as he moves off. Jack’s attention goes the SCRAPES on Kate’s cheek --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You okay? He touches the scratch gently, examining her injuries. Purely professional. And yet...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Is this where you say “I told you so?”

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m not big on rubbing it in. Kate smiles. They’re CLOSE. But then, a sober moment --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Locke’s gone. That... thing... in there. I think it got him. Jack absorbs that for a moment. Shakes his head. Kate notices the CASTAWAYS beginning to gather near the fusela

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The fuselage is ready to go. (beat) Some of the others decided to... I guess some words are gonna be said... over the fire... Names read, I think...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s good. A little closure.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (distracted) Yeah.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 48.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t think they're ready to know what we -- She pauses, suddenly realizing Jack is looking past her a something. HIS POV - The OLDER MAN in the white shoes, mostly obscur by the foliage. Kate sees Jack’s expression:

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? But Jack is already moving past her, toward The OLDER MAN who moves off deeper into the jungle. Jack’s rushing to the edge of the jungle, Kate right behi him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack -- He’s about to dive in when... A LARGE FORM emerges from the brush. Jack and Kate come t sudden halt and look upon... LOCKE, his brow and arms slightly bloodied, his arms slun over a long stick across his shoulders, not unlike a scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Locke -- ? Locke suddenly heaves the stick off of him and we see a D BOAR, hog-tied to it. The carcass hits the ground before them. CLOSE ON LOCKE - His face flush with the kill, his chest heaving...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT FOUR
dialogues.text: 73 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE SHOT - We see smoke and fiery embers rising up agai the night sky, then TILT DOWN onto THE BURNING FUSELAGE, and the CROWD of SURVIVORS standing before it, some bowing their heads in prayer, others quie crying -- all the while hearing Claire’s voice: *

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Judith Martha Walker... Denton, Texas... Guess she was gonna catch a connecting flight... * (studying the license) Uh, well, she wore corrective lenses. And... she was an organ donor... CUT IN ON CLAIRE, sniffling her way through these impromp eulogies - (occasionally popping in on others as they listen.) HURLEY stands next to her, holding various I.D.s documents and other items. BOONE is also near, holding up TORCH, giving her the light to read. [NOTE: We may also s an iPod propped up on some luggage, along with two extern speakers, as we hear an appropriate SONG playing. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE (CONT’D) Or would've been... * She hands off the license to Hurley, who hands her the wedding plans she found earlier. She reacts... CLAIRE (CONT’D) Oh... yeah. Steve and Kristen. I don’t know their last names, but... They were in love... And they were going to be married-- (her voice breaks) At least At least wherever they are now... they have each other... They're not alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARC around a tree as CLAIRE’S faltering voice continues i the background, to find CHARLIE, taking a hit from his bag of dope. He closes his eyes, letting the numbness wash over him, and shoves the back into his pocket. (There ain’t much left.) * WE GO WITH HIM as he steps out from his hiding place and rejoins the crowd, winding up next to KATE, near the back  74 75 LOST "Walkabout" (PINK) 7/22/04 50. PANNING ACROSS the gathered, we see LOCKE, next to WALT a MICHAEL, then SAYID, SHANNON, SAWYER, SUN and JIN, and, finally, ROSE, her eyes closed, appearing almost serene. CLAIRE (CONT’D) ...-Manuel Raphael Ortiz... Los Angeles... He turned thirty-two... wow, just last week... And, well, looks like Diego didn’t travel much -- At least as far as we can tell from his passport... (off piece of paper) .-. But, oh, he must’ve had children... A video store receipt in his wallet lists overdue charges... Willy Wonka and... The Little Princess... ON KATE, standing by CHARLIE. She scans the assembled.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (whispering, to Charlie) Have you seen Jack? Charlie looks around, but can only shrug. Off Kate’s concerned look, as we hear Claire:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So... I guess... (becoming emotional) I expect they’re missing their daddy right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the fiery fuselage and congregated survivors way o in the distance, then BOOM DOWN to find JACK, sitting alone, staring out over the ocean, far down beach where Rose had sat. Lost in troubled thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear Claire reading on, we find MICHAEL - He glances over at Locke, who doesn’t look back After a beat, they speak in whispers...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: What?  76 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 51.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: The boar. Nice work. Y’‘know... Killing it. (beat) Just thought I should say something. Locke looks at him a moment, then nods, accepting Michael compliment, and returns to looking at the funeral pyre. Another beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, that... Thing... The monster, whatever... She said it was heading right toward you... Locke now turns and looks directly into Michael’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you see it? I mean, did you get any kind of look at it? A moment passes before Locke shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: No. Michael stares back at Locke for a beat. Then nods and tu back to the service. As does Locke. PUSH IN ON Locke’s face - flames flickering in his eyes.. INT. MELBOURNE WALKABOUT TOURS - MORNING —- FLASHBACK 76 CLOSE ON an Aussie TRAVEL AGENT, sitting at his desk insi the storefront operation.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT
dialogues.text: -- The Walkabouts we arrange aren’t just some stroll through the park... It’s trekking over vast stretches of desert -- rafting treacherous waters -- climbing -- CLOSE ON LOCKE, sitting across from him, dressed in a kha vest, cap and dark sunglasses. A small, bitter smile mask his contempt.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: You've got no idea who you’re talking to. Believe me. I’m well aware of what’s involved... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 52.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Probably know more than you on the subject--

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) In any case, it’s a trying ordeal for someone in peak physical condition, let alone --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Look -- I booked this tour a month ago. You've already got my money. Now I demand a place on that bus--

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT LOCKE
dialogues.text: You misrepresented yourself. -- I_never lied.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT
dialogues.text: By omission, Mr. Locke! You neglected to tell us about your condition --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: (snapping) My condition -- is not an issue! I’ve lived with it for four years and it’s never kept me--

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT
dialogues.text: Yes, well, unfortunately, it’s an issue to our insurance company. Seeing this going nowhere, the Travel Agent stands crosses past Locke, who doesn’t get up.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I can’t keep the bus waiting any longer. It isn’t fair to the other people--

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me about fair! --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT
dialogues.text: -- We can put you on a plane back to Sydney on our dime. It’s the best we can do-- and We see through a large window, a tour bus waiting to leav its doors open, the guide on the steps looking at his wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 53.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go back to Sydney! I’ve spent years preparing for this. -- You put me on that bus right now! I can do this!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEL AGENT
dialogues.text: (at the doorway) No. You can’t. He exits to confer with the guide as Locke yells after hi

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Don’t you walk away from me! He suddenly swivels around...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t know who you’re dealing with. -- Don’t ever tell me what I can’t do! Ever!... * As he rolls himself toward the window, PULL OUT to REVEAL LOCKE IS IN A WHEELCHAIR. And has been throughout the ent flashbacks. Shot to hide it, but dropping subtle clues: T unscuffed shoes, the waist-high shelving, the EMS unit, e THE BUS doors close and it pulls away. The Travel Agent looks back at Locke, shakes his head and walks away. Just doesn’t want to deal with the guy...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is destiny! This is my destiny! I’m supposed to do this, dammit!!!

dialogues.speaker: OF
dialogues.text: PULL UP HIGH and WIDE, Locke looking small and impotent..

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: DON’T TELL ME WHAT I CAN’T--

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BEACH —- DAY 77 LOCKE’S TOES - Wiggling beneath their sock. ANGLE ON LOCKE staring dumbly at them, then, as before, h retrieves his pristine shoe (understanding its clean beca HE'S NEVER WALKED ON IT) -- and puts it on.  78 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 54. Once he does, he looks up to the sky, almost serenely... if an understanding’s been reached. Locke braces himself on a large, nearby, piece of wreckag and carefully pulls himself up to his feet. He takes stoc of his legs, gently rubbing them -- They appear steady, a he wills them to take... one... two... three... tentative steps. Then a couple more confident ones. CLOSE ON LOCKE - Turning back to the scene of carnage -- face flush with this “miracle” as he puts his hand on his hips and watches -- CUT IN TO COVERAGE FROM THE PILOT - Shannon screaming, Ji calling out, Michael looking for Walt, etc., and we HEAR Jack's voice, yelling over the whine of the jet engine...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- get over here -- gimme a hand -- ON LOCKE, glancing over at JACK, who turns and sees him:

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You! C’mon... Come over here! Gimme a hand! -- TIGHT CLOSE-UP ON LOCKE, looking over at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LOCKE - His eyes drift over to something past the crow HIS POV - THE WHEELCHAIR, a short distance from the burni fuselage, resting idle and empty. CLOSE ON LOCKE, as a small smile curls the corner of his lips.
